CWEs: CWE-209: Information Exposure Through an Error Message
CWE-22: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')
description: The function is vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS) attacks because it does not limit the size of the image that can be requested. This can lead to the server running out of memory if a large image is requested. The function also exposes potentially sensitive information in its error messages, which can be exploited by an attacker to gain more information about the system. Additionally, the function does not properly validate the URL parameter, which can lead to Path Traversal attacks if an attacker is able to manipulate the URL to access restricted directories.
